data.title: Good Steak, but way too many high fat sauces
data.text: Enjoyed a Steak here, was pretty pricey, but good. My main complaint was the fact that all the vegetables side came lathered in butter or oil. I found the wine list entry level too high to enjoy with my steak. Beer and the house steak is probably the way to go here.

data.title: The Best Steaks in Town
data.text: The steaks and wine were excellent. Service missed a beat when the appetizer was not delivered. Otherwise, I would go back, make sure I get an appetizer and enjoy the best steak in town.

owner_response.author: Jason B, Owner at Prime Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for the kind words, it appears we owe you an appetizer. On your next visit please ask for Kevin or Jason, we would be happy to deliver that to you personally.

Best regards,

Jason
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: What a pleasant surprise!
data.text: I thought this was going to be one of those 'try hard'e restaurants but I was pleasantly surprised. My husband and I are local, but were staying in a Redmond hotel for a week and were eating out most nights. We'd seen this place and heard the happy hour was good, but thought we'd give the dinner a try. The steaks were amazing - really top quality and the service is far better than either of us expected, but it's not cheap and for the price, I would have liked the crockery to be of a better quality, but let's face it, I was there for the steak and it was worth every penny!

data.title: affordable yet excellent
data.text: Great starters (deviled eggs and Brussels sprouts), lovely rib eye and good cocktails, paired with a lovely waitress made for a prime dinner evening.

data.title: Very good though not the best
data.text:
We all thought everything was good but not amazing. The halibut was fresh and the steaks were good but didn't seem quite as high quality as say Flemings or Mastros. 

The gem was actually the burger which was delicious and very fairly priced. 

Service was friendly.

data.title: Superb serving, food and drink
data.text:
I went to the Prime Steakhouse for a team evening out. It was exceptionally good. Luke was our waiter and he was a maestro! He was the very model of politeness and service; I just couldn't fault him.
The atmosphere is conducive to good times. And the food is exemplary. They have a wide selection of beverages and some really delicious cocktails.
Everything was so enjoyable that I came back the next day for my final meal in Redmond, before travelling to the airport to fly back to the United Kingdom.

data.title: Expensive menu, Quiet in Afternoon
data.text: We stopped for lunch in mid-afternoon.  Service was good but the food was so-so.  The menu also was a bit pricey.  The onion soup was good.

data.title: A regular stop for us
data.text: We have really taken a shine to Prime. It has become one of our regular stops. Being vegetarian and Gluten Free, finding a place where we can get good food that meets our dietary needs is not easy. We are always pleasantly surprised when we can find a place like Prime that caters to both. We eat out about 4 times a month regularly and Prime is probably one of the places we go to each month. The services can be a bit slow at times, but the friendly folks, great food and a well stocked bar makes it worth it

data.title: Classy joint
data.text: Prime has a nice atmosphere, a great bar area with very capable bartenders, and good food reasonably priced - particularly their happy hour menu. Even the flagship steak offerings, while pricey, are a great value compared to more expensive local alternatives. Gastronomes will enjoy the bone marrow appetizer. Every meal we've had there has been a good one, though I've decided once and for all that sous vide steak is not for me. I know it's the hip, trendy thing - but not for this guy. Make reservations, arrive early if not.

data.title: Fine steakhouse in downtown Redmond
data.text: This is a high quality fine dining steak house that is conveniently located in downtown Redmond.  They have quality food and a good wine selection.

data.title: Surprised at the bad reviews
data.text:
I love this place,it is a great addition to downtown Redmond.Now the disclaimer-I only eat here at happy hour which is a fabulous deal.The main restaurant is simply too expensive but it does have some reasonably priced items on the menu as long as you are not ordering steak
The serve craft cocktails and I have tried various ones and liked them all
The bartenders wait on you in the bar area and they are  knowledgeable, friendly and most of all pour you a stiff drink!
Last trip I tried a Corpse Reviver which is my new favorite drink
Now to the food
It is really hard to get a decent version of French Onion soup these days but Prime has the best
And I mean better than mine and I make mine from scratch with my own beef stock
Flavorful and just spilling over with cheese like it's supposed too
Everything I've eaten I've liked- the burger, beef bites, curry mussels, wedge salad . My husband ordered the creamed spinach off the main menu and he said it was the best version he's had. The portion is huge so definitely shareable 
Usually too stuffed for dessert but the one I had once( some chocolate thing) was very good
This place is number one in my happy hour rotation in my local area of Redmond and Bellevue
Highly recommended

data.title: Unexpected delight on a Friday night
data.text:
This was actually our fourth choice on a Friday night when we were looking for a place to eat (everything was packed... crazy Redmond!). The restaurant was larger than expected (I think it used to be a burrito joint back in the day, so was surprised to see the restaurant spreads all the way into the back) we were seated right away (a plus, trust me on a Friday without reservations - though I wouldn't recommend it, the place packed out quickly).  

The staff was friendly and attentive with suggestions for appetizers and steak cuts. We had the Charcuterie for an appetizer, nice cheeses/meats, and we both tried the NY cut (I had it Oscar Style and hub had the Peppercorn) - mine came out perfectly, the hubs came out blue (he asked for medium) - it took a few moments to get the server's attention to have the steak cooked more, but eventually it came back out a bit more 'done' (not quite medium).  The steak 'extras' were delish though - I just wish they would have checked to make sure they were done properly (hence 4 stars instead of 5). - for a $250 meal they should have had flashlights and the first cut done upon arrival of the steak.  :)  We will try again though - yummy food.

data.title: Excellent New York steak
data.text:
I've ordered New York steak.
It was just perfect. Juicy and soft.
It was made perfect Medium rare as I asked.
The service was great and warm.

The prices are high though. So it won't be my regular place.

data.title: Very Tasty - Very Expensive
data.text: Went the day after Valentines Day. First visit to this downtown Redmond restaurant. Several open tables and not unusual for a Monday night. This place is trying to be a high end steakhouse like Daniels or John Howie and is charging prices that are similar however, its just not........on many levels. Ambience, glassblock wall???, service, burger bar at best, quality of silverware, comfort of seating, tight tables hard chairs, Happy Hour specials. If I am paying $60 for a steak I want a decent steak knife. I want bread that is more upmarket than sourdough bowl style. I think they should lower the prices a bit to accommodate a mid week customer. I think I will go to Daniels next time for a $250 bill for 4 of us without alcohol.....BTW they also offered us the 'yesterdays Valentines specials' for the same price as the day before as they had not sold all their inventory! Too funny............

data.title: Good Steaks, Friendly Service, East-side Prices
data.text: Went there with 2 colleagues after work. Warm welcome, courteous staff, got a table in a nice quiet corner, as otherwise the restaurant was quite noisy. Ordered steaks - naturally. One member in our group got Ragu beef steak, same one John Howie sells 50-60 USD more expensive. I heard it was mind blowing. I got a 16oz ribeye, and boy I got full. Taste was also right, so despite the ~50USD price tag, I felt I got value for money. so, everyone enjoyed their meals. Overall nice, cozy atmosphere, with a hint of fine dining with very friendly and knowledgeable staff.

data.title: Fell below expectations
data.text: We waited in the foyer for 30 minutes and should have turned around and gone out.  We watched one particular cook handle food with his bare hands, when other cooks had blue gloves on.  He also didn't have a hairnet on his beard.  We spent nearly $700 on dinner, most of our party ordered high end steaks.  My steak was luke warm when it arrived.  Noise level was so high I had to ask the waiter to come closer so I could even hear the specials. We were there to celebrate a special occasion with our family.  If you're going to pay high prices for good food, go to another restaurant.  What a disappointment.

data.title: Am I invisible? Service needs to step up.
data.text: I want to love this place. Menu is interesting and drinks are pretty good. It has a grown up, swanky feel, which is nice in Redmond.  Now, if they could just work on their bar service I'd re-rate much higher. I literally sat in the bar, which was about 1/3 full (7 people)  and tried to get the bartenders attention for 20 minutes while he cleaned, organized and just wandered around. There were 4 wait staff huddled 3 feet from the bar all chatting and laughing - but there's no one taking anyone's orders!! I actually went and asked hostess who was taking orders in the bar and she said the bartender will come to me. Hmmm- never did. I would've left if I wasn't meeting someone. I don't get frustrated easily at restaurants, but this was rediculous. Step it up, Prime. I would be a good customer if I felt I wasn't ignored.

owner_response.author: Jason B, Owner at Prime Steakhouse, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Good afternoon roadtripdeb,

First let me start by thanking you for the kind, positive remarks about my restaurant, they are very much appreciated. Unfortunately there is a second, I was disappointed to hear about the service you received, absolutely unacceptable.  I feel the need to address this with the appropriate staff to ensure there is not a repeat occurrence.  At your convenience would you be able to tell me the date and time you joined us?  If you should ever encounter a situation like this again please feel free to ask for either Kevin or myself, between the two of us we are here 95% of the time.

Thank you,
Hoping you give us another opportuniy.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pretty good for a second date.
data.text: A little on the pricey side but food was generously portioned and tasted great. Atmosphere was a little noisy both in the bar and in the seated area.

data.title: Wonderful steaks and great service
data.text: For a special occasion, you must try Prime.  The appetizers, steaks and wine selection was wonderful.  We will definitely stop in again when in Redmond

data.title: Great waiter, steaks are not yet great
data.text: The waiter knows his story very well, can explain all the different beef cuts. Wish the chef knew as well. steaks are okay but certainly not great. If you have such good story to tell then make it come through to you food and show so passion in the beef...
